public class WrappingClassRecipe
extends ClassRecipe

WrappingClassRecipe(ClassRecipe, Enumeration, int)
The new Recipe subsets the authority of 'wrapped' by disallowing any signatures not in 'allowed', and by disallowing any fields whose modifiers intersect with those of 'modifierMask'.

approve(FieldKnife)
forSignature(String)
If "Foo" is allowed, then so is "[Foo", "[[Foo", etc..

WrappingClassRecipe 
  public WrappingClassRecipe(ClassRecipe wrapped,
                             Enumeration allowed,
                             int modifierMask)
The new Recipe subsets the authority of 'wrapped' by disallowing any signatures not in 'allowed', and by disallowing any fields whose modifiers intersect with those of 'modifierMask'.
Parameters:
wrapped - Where we delegate requests we approve
allowed - nullOk The allowed signatures are the keys of 'myAllowed'. It doesn't matter what values are used since containsKey() is what we test. If myAllowed is null, we aren't filtering signatures.
modifierMask - Each one bit in here represents a forbidden Field modifier. For example, if the Modifier.TRANSIENT bit is on, we will not ask myWrapped to approve FieldKnives representing transient instance variables.

forSignature 
  public Class forSignature(String sig)
If "Foo" is allowed, then so is "[Foo", "[[Foo", etc..
Overrides:
forSignature in class ClassRecipe
approve 
  public void approve(FieldKnife knife)
Overrides:
approve in class ClassRecipe
